title: Close Contact Precautions Could Prevent an Outbreak of Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever: A Case Series Report from Southern Part of Tehran
patient: This 29-year-old pregnant female with gestational age of 32 weeks, whose two brothers-in-law had died, was admitted for better evaluation. She denied any history of bleeding, myalgia, arthralgia or fever. Physical examination and laboratory findings were all normal.\nObstetric examination and sonography showed normal alive fetus. The patient only was observed and was discharged after 3 days.\nHer RT-PCR was reported negative for CCHF virus.
